laboratory_examinations.findings: Lipase level is 2305, indicating significantly elevated levels consistent with pancreatitis.

Significant peripancreatic fatty stranding, fluid, and thickening of the left perirenal fascia. Hypoenhancement of the pancreatic tail compatible with necrosis. Ill-defined intermediate density focus likely representing scarring or fat necrosis, unchanged in appearance.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Focus in the left lower quadrant measuring 5.3 x 1.3 cm is grossly unchanged from a prior exam.
